Key Match Events: Mena scored the only goal of the match in the 21st minute.
Torres and Preciado received yellow cards in the 36th and 61st minutes respectively.
Pulgar and Echeverria received yellow cards in the 44th and 62nd minutes respectively.
Pre-Game Insights: Ecuador and Chile are both dealing with off-the-pitch issues.
Chile's manager Eduardo Berizzo resigned after a draw with Paraguay.
Ecuador started the qualifying campaign with a three-point deduction.
Chile's Alexis Sanchez apologized to his former manager for the team's performance.
Chile has won only one of their opening five qualifiers.
Ecuador is in the top six despite starting with a points deduction.
Ecuador has shown defensive solidity, keeping several clean sheets in recent matches.
Ecuador will be without key players Enner Valencia and Pervis Estupinan due to injury.
Chile will be without Victor Mendez due to a red card and several other players due to injuries.
